intro: Genistoides, commonly known as the evergreen acacia, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their compound leaves and small, yellow or white flowers arranged in racemes. They are native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. Genistoides species often thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh climates. Their ability to fix nitrogen makes them important in soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
